title: I'm doing at my school that requires having to search for an apartment. Where is a cheap but commutable city to live in Japan? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are no cheap cities, only cheap apartments. The further away from Tokyo or big cities the cheaper your rent will be. My last apartment was 50,000 yen a month for a cheap hovel. Look at how much you can afford and what you can afford to spend on trains to get to school, or maybe invest in a scooter.
This question probably needs to be rephrased. Is it a project for your school? Are you relocating to or inside of Japan? Cheap relative to what? Commutable relative to where?
